important_phrase: Recent rains improved conditions in many parts of the District
Most retailers indicated that sales growth had slowed with the exception of   autos, which remained quite positive
Meanwhile, contacts also continued to note difficulty filling highly   skilled positions
Contacts also reported robust auto lending
District air cargo contacts cited   continued positive growth, however at a slightly slower pace than earlier in the   year
Reports from District homebuilders remained positive as well
Most contacts in the retail   sector reported generally slower sales
Outlooks remain uncertain
New England staffing firms generally   report lighter-than-expected volumes through mid-August, with most contacts   characterizing business as "slow" or "flat
All other responding firms report flat or rising sales
Most contacts predict   year-over-year growth in sales, albeit at a slower pace than recently, and   anticipate modest increases in the median sale price of homes in coming months
Respondents still express uncertainty about the   direction of the US economy and say they expect little improvement over the   next six to eight months
Livestock pastures are   in poor shape as well, and fields with low corn yields were being chopped for   silage to feed livestock
Business spending increased at a slower pace, while consumer   spending growth picked up some
Wge pressures   continued to be moderate, although several contacts cited upward pressure on   healthcare costs
Credit conditions gradually improved   over the reporting period
Growth in business spending slowed from   the prior reporting period
Construction activity   continued to increase at a slow but steady pace in July and early August
Sales of big-ticket items such as furniture again were weak, although sales of   electronics improved some
Spot prices for steam   coal have increased slightly, while prices for export metallurgical coal   declined further
Natural gas producers   increased production, though the demand for coal has softened
Delinquencies were steady or improved
Raw material   prices were either stable or declined
Building material prices were stable
Purchases of used vehicles improved slightly during July   relative to June levels
Drought conditions improved slightly due to   scattered rainfall in July
Energy activity remained robust, and agricultural conditions   improved slightly
Employment levels edged up or held steady at   most responding firms
The quality of outstanding loans   continued to improve slowly as nonperforming loans declined
Stffing firms said demand slowed slightly over   the past six weeks
Outlooks were optimistic but cautious
Contacts said political   uncertainty was hampering consumer confidence, and outlooks were cautious
District energy activity remained fairly stable at   high levels in July and early August
Transportation activity grew moderately, while sales in the high-tech services   sector declined slightly
Retail prices increased slightly, and   additional price increases were expected to remain modest
In the recent survey period, bankers generally   reported slightly stronger loan demand, improving loan quality, and little   change in deposits
Sales at high-tech   services firms decreased slightly, and capital spending grew modestly
Commercial real estate conditions also improved
Auto sales increased sharply as more   incentives were offered and access to credit improved slightly
The agriculture sector was mixed
Prices were relatively stable
Prices were relatively stable
Manufacturing activity slowed
Commercial real estate markets continued to expand
July same-store sales at a   Montana mall increased slightly compared with a year ago
Oil and gas activity continued to be robust across most Districts
New York, Philadelphia, and Chicago indicated improvements as   well, but characterized the progress as slow and modest
Most Districts reported   that employment was holding steady or growing only slightly
Credit conditions have   improved over the reporting period according to District reports
Reports on transportation services were generally positive
New York, Philadelphia, and Chicago indicated improvements as   well, but characterized the progress as slow and modest
" In the Atlanta District, most retail contacts reported   slower sales, while Boston's retail contacts provided a mixed assessment
Retailers, however, report generally favorable results:   auto dealers note that sales remain fairly strong, and non-auto retailers report   some recent improvement
Respondents also note continued declines in the average   deposit rate
Labor market conditions across the District have been mixed, but somewhat   weaker, on balance, since the last report
Housing markets across the   District have shown further signs of modest improvement since the last report
Tourism activity has been mixed but generally strong since the last report
Retailers, auto dealers, financial firms, and other service-sector firms   remain positive about the near-term outlook but are increasingly cautious due to   their customers' rising uncertainty
Homebuilders and retailers continue to report tight margins but   little additional escalation of the prices that they face

Although the   overall outlook among lenders was positive, there is an expectation of tempered   growth until after the election, and there are concerns about the impacts of the   fiscal decisions that will follow
Firms have slightly lowered their overall expectations of   future capital spending and future hiring since the last Beige Book
Builders and brokers share a cautiously   optimistic outlook
However, dealers remain concerned that rising consumer uncertainty will dampen   sales for the second half of the year
Rain in early August aided late summer peaches in Maryland and Wst Virginia,   and soybeans were responding to improved weather conditions in Virginia
Manufacturing activity softened as orders declined
According to our recent surveys,   wages in both the manufacturing and service sectors were growing at a slightly   slower pace than a month ago
A lending   officer in northern Virginia reported a slowdown in industrial loans due to   rising economic uncertainty
According to our latest manufacturing survey, growth in raw   materials prices slowed over the past month, while finished goods prices edged   downward
Similarly, a contractor reported a   solid increase in home sales in the Charleston, South Carolina area, with the   average price of new homes sold rising slightly as well
Retailers reported improved sales since our last   report
Orders and sales grew for many   crop and livestock products, and one report indicated that demand for cotton was   particularly strong
Price inflation was   limited for most final goods and services, and upward wage pressures were quite   contained
Price inflation was limited for most   final goods and services during the reporting period
Demand for consumer credit remained   relatively strong, reflected primarily in high lending activity for automobile   and home purchases
By contrast, the slowdown continued for makers of information technology   equipment, with sales declines reported for some equipment categories in recent   months
Home demand in the District   continued to improve, while demand for commercial real estate was largely   stable
Retail sales expanded a bit   further overall
Similarly, the fraction of pasture rated in fair or better condition   declined in all District states
Residential real estate market conditions   have continued to improve moderately
Credit standards for commercial real estate loans remained generally unchanged,   while demand ranged from moderately weaker to moderately stronger
Several manufacturers reported plans to expand operations and hire new workers,   while fewer manufacturers reported plans to lay off workers
A contact in   St Louis reported moderate improvement in office real estate activity and   strong demand in the industrial real estate market
About 13 percent of the retailers noted that their inventories   were too high, while 8 percent reported that their inventories were too low
